revised_title: Chemisorption of Unsaturated Hydrocarbons on Iron Single Crystal Surface
tldr: The chemisorption of simple and halogeno-substituted unsaturated hydrocarbons on the α-Fe(111) single crystal surface is studied using photoelectron spectroscopy. The results show that ethylene and halogeno-substituted alkenes adsorb irreversibly and dissociatively on the Fe(111) surface at 300 K. Carbon-carbon bond breaking of acetylene is observed at low coverage, while the chemisorption regime at higher coverages is more complex.
